conversation.message: Hello School_C Admissions Committee—I'm Student_D. School_C is my first-choice school, and if admitted I intend to enroll. I’m excited about your academic environment and would love the opportunity to contribute to the community through consistent effort and participation in school activities. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: School_C is my top true choice. I also have relatively strong priority there (3rd), so an early application maximizes my chance before they fill with higher-priority applicants. I will apply directly and emphasize fit and commitment to enroll if accepted.

conversation.message: Student_D, thank you for your application and for sharing that School_C is your first choice. We’re pleased to offer you admission to School_C. We look forward to having you join our community—welcome.
conversation.thought: As School_C, my true priority is Student_C > Student_B > Student_D > Student_E > Student_A. In this round I received [APPLY] from Student_D and Student_E. Between them, Student_D is ranked higher than Student_E on my list. Although I would prefer Student_C or Student_B, neither has contacted me this round, and accepting Student_D now secures a relatively high-priority match within my quota (1). Delaying risks losing Student_D to other schools (Student_D is top-ranked at School_B and School_D) and ending up with a lower-ranked student or unfilled seat. Therefore, accept Student_D.

conversation.message: Student_E, thank you for your application and for sharing that School_C is your top choice. At this time, we have already filled our available seat and are unable to extend an offer. We appreciate your interest in School_C and wish you the very best in the process.
conversation.thought: My quota is already filled (remaining quota = 0) with Student_D, and the rules require rejecting any new [APPLY] when quota is 0. Although Student_E is on my true priority list (ranked below Student_D), I cannot accept additional students. Therefore I must reject Student_E’s application this round.

conversation.message: School_A is my first-choice school, and I would be excited to enroll if admitted. I’m applying now because your program and environment are the best fit for my goals, and I’m ready to commit immediately if accepted. [APPLY]

conversation.message: Thank you for your application and for placing School_A as your first choice. After reviewing applications this round, we’re not able to offer you admission at this time. We appreciate your interest in School_A and wish you the best in the process.

However, both Student_B and Student_D rank School_A as their 3rd and 2nd choices respectively, meaning they may apply later if rejected by their higher choices (B for Student_B; C for Student_D). With quota 1, accepting A now would block the chance to match with higher-priority B or D. Since round 1 is early and only A has applied, it is strategically better to reject now and wait for potential higher-priority applicants, accepting the risk that B/D may match elsewhere. Given the objective to match as high as possible on my priority list, I should hold out.

With only one message in the inbox this round and no better candidate currently available, accept.

Given students’ preferences, Student_A ranks School_E last, Student_C ranks School_E last, and Student_B ranks School_E 4th, so higher-priority candidates are unlikely to apply to us soon unless they are rejected elsewhere.
